alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Door; Kewaunee; Langlade; Lincoln; Manitowoc; Marathon; Menominee; Northern Marinette County; Northern Oconto County; Outagamie; Portage; Shawano; Southern Marinette County; Southern Oconto County; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 24 at 6:10AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW WILL CREATE HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS IN OPEN AREAS TODAY... Northwest winds gusting to 35 to 40 mph will continue to generate blowing and drifting snow in open areas today. The impact on travel in urban and heavily forested areas will be minimal. But travel through open areas could be much more difficult as the visibility will be significantly reduced at times. Anyone traveling today should be especially alert for the possibility of encountering patches of icy and very slippery pavement in areas where the wind blows a thin layer of snow back across the road after snow plows have cleared off the deep snow. Often in these situations, the thin layer of fresh snow will be packed down by passing vehicles and polished off into a layer of glare ice. The core of the coldest air has shifted east of the area. So although it will still be cold today, temperatures will be 10 to 15 degrees warmer that at the same time yesterday. Wind chill indices of 15 below to 25 below zero are expected in central Wisconsin this morning. Wind chills of 10 below to 20 below zero are anticipated across most of the rest of the area, though slightly less harsh conditions are expected in far northeast Wisconsin.
